{"step_by_step_thinking": "Poikilokaryosis is a term used in pathology to describe a condition where there is variation in the size, shape, and staining of the nuclei in a cell. It does not refer to the alteration of nuclear cytoplasmic ratio, division of nuclei without division of cytoplasm, or loss of polarity and disorientation of cells. However, it can be associated with large, prominent nuclei.", "answer_choice": "C"}
